name: Honey Mustard Avocado (Crockpot)
instructions: Marinade: Whisk honey mustard with oil and a pinch of salt; marinate avocado 30–60 minutes.
Place the avocado and 1/2 cup broth in the slow cooker.
Cook on LOW 6–8 hours (or HIGH half the time) until tender.
Shred or slice and fold back into juices.
Garnish with cilantro and serve.
notes: Season to taste. Use a thermometer for doneness where applicable; rest meats before slicing.

name: Teriyaki Avocado (Air Fryer)
instructions: Preheat air fryer to 380–390°F.
Place the avocado in a single layer in the basket.
Toss in warmed teriyaki after air frying to coat.
Air fry, flipping halfway, until cooked through and edges are crisp.
Garnish with cilantro and serve.
notes: Season to taste. Use a thermometer for doneness where applicable; rest meats before slicing.

name: Teriyaki Avocado (No Cook)
instructions: In a mixing bowl, combine the avocado with seasonings and a drizzle of olive oil.
Fold in chopped vegetables or herbs as desired.
Fold in a splash of teriyaki-style dressing.
Chill 10–15 minutes to let flavors meld; serve.
Garnish with cilantro and serve.
notes: Season to taste. Use a thermometer for doneness where applicable; rest meats before slicing.

name: Tomato Basil Avocado (Crockpot)
instructions: Marinade: Combine oil with spices/herbs; marinate avocado 30–60 minutes (seafood 15–30).
Place the avocado and 1/2 cup broth in the slow cooker.
Cook on LOW 6–8 hours (or HIGH half the time) until tender.
Shred or slice and fold back into juices.
Garnish with cilantro and serve.
notes: Season to taste. Use a thermometer for doneness where applicable; rest meats before slicing.

name: Garlic Herb Bacon (Instant Pot)
instructions: Marinade: Combine oil with spices/herbs; marinate bacon 30–60 minutes (seafood 15–30).
Set Instant Pot to Sauté and warm a little oil.
Sear the bacon briefly on both sides; cancel Sauté.
Add 1/2–3/4 cup broth or sauce. Seal and Pressure Cook; natural release 5 minutes, then quick release.
Garnish with chives and serve.
notes: Season to taste. Use a thermometer for doneness where applicable; rest meats before slicing.

name: Honey Mustard Bacon (Instant Pot)
instructions: Marinade: Whisk honey mustard with oil and a pinch of salt; marinate bacon 30–60 minutes.
Set Instant Pot to Sauté and warm a little oil.
Sear the bacon briefly on both sides; cancel Sauté.
Add 1/2–3/4 cup broth or sauce. Seal and Pressure Cook; natural release 5 minutes, then quick release.

notes: Season to taste. Use a thermometer for doneness where applicable; rest meats before slicing.

name: Sesame Ginger Bacon (Grill)
instructions: Marinade: Whisk soy-based sesame ginger mixture with oil; coat bacon and marinate 30–60 minutes in the refrigerator (seafood 15–30).
Preheat grill to medium‑high (375–400°F). Clean and oil the grates.
Grill the bacon 4–6 minutes per side (thicker pieces may need longer) until cooked through.
Rest 3–5 minutes before serving.
Garnish with chives and serve.
notes: Season to taste. Use a thermometer for doneness where applicable; rest meats before slicing.

name: Sesame Ginger Bacon (Stove Top)
instructions: Marinade: Whisk soy-based sesame ginger mixture with oil; coat bacon and marinate 30–60 minutes in the refrigerator (seafood 15–30).
Heat 1 tbsp oil in a large skillet over medium‑high heat.
Sear the bacon 3–4 minutes per side until browned.
Add sesame-ginger sauce and toss 1–2 minutes; sprinkle with toasted sesame.
Reduce heat and cook until done.
Garnish with chives and serve.
notes: Season to taste. Use a thermometer for doneness where applicable; rest meats before slicing.

name: Tomato Basil Bacon (Oven Bake)
instructions: Marinade: Combine oil with spices/herbs; marinate bacon 30–60 minutes (seafood 15–30).
Heat oven to 425°F. Line a sheet pan with parchment or foil.
Arrange the bacon on the pan (shake off excess marinade if used).
Spoon tomato-basil mixture over in the last 5 minutes.
Roast until cooked through, flipping once if needed.
Garnish with chives and serve.
notes: Season to taste. Use a thermometer for doneness where applicable; rest meats before slicing.

instructions: Heat 1 tbsp oil in a large skillet over medium‑high heat.

instructions: Marinade: Whisk soy-based teriyaki mixture with oil; coat steak and marinate 30–60 minutes in the refrigerator (seafood 15–30).
Place the steak and 1/2 cup broth in the slow cooker.
Cook on LOW 6–8 hours (or HIGH half the time) until tender.
Stir in a cornstarch slurry during the last 15 minutes to thicken the sauce.
Shred or slice and fold back into juices.
Garnish with chopped parsley or chimichurri and serve.
notes: Season to taste. Use a thermometer for doneness where applicable; rest meats before slicing.

name: Cajun Sweet Potato (Stove Top)
instructions: Heat 1 tbsp oil in a large skillet over medium‑high heat.
Sear the sweet potato 3–4 minutes per side until browned.
Reduce heat and cook until done.
Garnish with chives and serve.
notes: Season to taste. Use a thermometer for doneness where applicable; rest meats before slicing.

name: Chipotle Lime Sweet Potato (Stove Top)
instructions: Heat 1 tbsp oil in a large skillet over medium‑high heat.
Sear the sweet potato 3–4 minutes per side until browned.
Deglaze pan with a squeeze of lime and a spoon of chipotle; simmer 30 seconds.
Reduce heat and cook until done.
Garnish with chives and serve.
notes: Season to taste. Use a thermometer for doneness where applicable; rest meats before slicing.

Cook on LOW 6–8 hours (or HIGH half the time) until tender.
Shred or slice and fold back into juices.
Garnish with basil and serve.
notes: Season to taste. Use a thermometer for doneness where applicable; rest meats before slicing.

name: Harissa Zucchini Ribbons (No Cook)
instructions: In a mixing bowl, combine the zucchini ribbons with seasonings and a drizzle of olive oil.
Fold in chopped vegetables or herbs as desired.
Chill 10–15 minutes to let flavors meld; serve.
Garnish with basil and serve.
notes: Season to taste. Use a thermometer for doneness where applicable; rest meats before slicing.

name: Lemon Pepper Zucchini Ribbons (Instant Pot)
instructions: Marinade: Combine oil with spices/herbs; marinate zucchini ribbons 30–60 minutes (seafood 15–30).
Set Instant Pot to Sauté and warm a little oil.
Sear the zucchini ribbons briefly on both sides; cancel Sauté.
Add 1/2–3/4 cup broth or sauce. Seal and Pressure Cook; natural release 5 minutes, then quick release.
Garnish with basil and serve.
notes: Season to taste. Use a thermometer for doneness where applicable; rest meats before slicing.

name: Pesto Zucchini Ribbons (Crockpot)
instructions: Marinade: Combine oil with spices/herbs; marinate zucchini ribbons 30–60 minutes (seafood 15–30).

notes: Season to taste. Use a thermometer for doneness where applicable; rest meats before slicing.

name: Sesame Ginger Zucchini Ribbons (Air Fryer)
instructions: Preheat air fryer to 380–390°F.
Place the zucchini ribbons in a single layer in the basket.
Toss with sesame-ginger sauce after air frying.
Air fry, flipping halfway, until cooked through and edges are crisp.
Garnish with basil and serve.
notes: Season to taste. Use a thermometer for doneness where applicable; rest meats before slicing.
